title: Change Default Pi Username
content: If you’re using Raspbian your default username is pi. In this article, I will teach you how to change this username, the password, and remap the home directory.

title: Jekyll Nginx Server
content: Here’s how to mimic the Jekyll Development Server with Nginx for a production environment.

title: Install NodeJs on Raspberry Pi
content: Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome’s V8 JavaScript engine. NodeJs is an increasingly popular language for developers across the board. Let’s cover how to install NodeJs on the Raspberry Pi.

title: Traveler's Notebook
content: The Traveler’s Notebook (TN) is a brilliant design. I’ve been carrying notebooks for a while now and love it. My phone is good for a movie title or song I want to remember, but I just prefer pen and paper for all else.

title: Glitch Projects
content: Let’s talk about Glitch! Glitch is a place to develop your NodeJs projects with community support and abundant inspiration.

title: LowDB Blog
content: LowDB Blog is a LowDB (ya don’t say?) and jQuery powered blog with a full private and public API. This repository is updated frequently.

title: Steal Your Consenting Friend's Gmail Password
content: Do you have a consenting friend who you just happen to need their password? Look no more, here is a complete set up.

title: WebLense
content: There is a cascade of URL-To-Image APIs out there. Most of them are pricey, overly-complicated, non-opensource and you don’t have control of the image files. WebLense takes care of this. WebLense is a self-hosted Url-To-Image API.

title: Jekyll Short Url
content: Jekyll Short Url uses Goo.gl as a backend and a small Script on your 404 page.

title: Node Gmail API
content: We will be building a simple Gmail API for easy notification use. Please note this is not the most secure method.

title: Easy Javascript Typing!
content: EasyType.jsWhat is EasyType.Js??? Well it is a super simple way to create a typing effect! EasyType.js (minified) is only 0.293kB.
